notes.text:
An update for firefox is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Critical. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, designed for standards compliance, performance, and portability.

This update upgrades Firefox to version 60.7.0 ESR.

Security Fix(es):

* Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 67 and Firefox ESR 60.7 (CVE-2019-9800)

* Mozilla: Cross-origin theft of images with createImageBitmap (CVE-2019-9797)

* Mozilla: Type confusion with object groups and UnboxedObjects (CVE-2019-9816)

* Mozilla: Stealing of cross-domain images using canvas (CVE-2019-9817)

* Mozilla: Compartment mismatch with fetch API (CVE-2019-9819)

* Mozilla: Use-after-free of ChromeEventHandler by DocShell (CVE-2019-9820)

* Mozilla: Use-after-free in XMLHttpRequest (CVE-2019-11691)

* Mozilla: Use-after-free removing listeners in the event listener manager (CVE-2019-11692)

* Mozilla: Buffer overflow in WebGL bufferdata on Linux (CVE-2019-11693)

* mozilla: Cross-origin theft of images with ImageBitmapRenderingContext (CVE-2018-18511)

* chromium-browser: Out of bounds read in Skia (CVE-2019-5798)

* Mozilla: Theft of user history data through drag and drop of hyperlinks to and from bookmarks (CVE-2019-11698)

* libpng: use-after-free in png_image_free in png.c (CVE-2019-7317)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: Cross-origin images can be read from a canvas element in violation of the same-origin policy using the transferFromImageBitmap method. *Note: This only affects Firefox 65. Previous versions are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 65.0.1.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: mozilla: Cross-origin theft of images with ImageBitmapRenderingContext
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: mozilla: Cross-origin theft of images with ImageBitmapRenderingContext

notes.text: Lack of correct bounds checking in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 73.0.3683.75 allowed a remote attacker to perform an out of bounds memory read via a crafted HTML page.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: chromium-browser: Out of bounds read in Skia
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

notes.text: png_image_free in png.c in libpng 1.6.x before 1.6.37 has a use-after-free because png_image_free_function is called under png_safe_execute.

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.

cwe.name: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere

notes.text: Cross-origin images can be read in violation of the same-origin policy by exporting an image after using createImageBitmap to read the image and then rendering the resulting bitmap image within a canvas element. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 66.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Cross-origin theft of images with createImageBitmap
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.
notes.title: Statement

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Cross-origin theft of images with createImageBitmap

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 66, Firefox ESR 60.6, and Thunderbird 60.6. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 67 and Firefox ESR 60.7
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 67 and Firefox ESR 60.7

cwe.name: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')

notes.text: A possible vulnerability exists where type confusion can occur when manipulating JavaScript objects in object groups, allowing for the bypassing of security checks within these groups. *Note: this vulnerability has only been demonstrated with UnboxedObjects, which are disabled by default on all supported releases.*. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Type confusion with object groups and UnboxedObjects
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Type confusion with object groups and UnboxedObjects

cwe.name: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere

notes.text: Images from a different domain can be read using a canvas object in some circumstances. This could be used to steal image data from a different site in violation of same-origin policy. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Stealing of cross-domain images using canvas
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Stealing of cross-domain images using canvas

cwe.name: Unsynchronized Access to Shared Data in a Multithreaded Context

notes.text: A vulnerability where a JavaScript compartment mismatch can occur while working with the fetch API, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Compartment mismatch with fetch API
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Compartment mismatch with fetch API

notes.text: A use-after-free vulnerability can occur in the chrome event handler when it is freed while still in use. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Use-after-free of ChromeEventHandler by DocShell
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Use-after-free of ChromeEventHandler by DocShell

notes.text: A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when working with XMLHttpRequest (XHR) in an event loop, causing the XHR main thread to be called after it has been freed. This results in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Use-after-free in XMLHttpRequest
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

notes.text: A use-after-free vulnerability can occur when listeners are removed from the event listener manager while still in use, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Use-after-free removing listeners in the event listener manager

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Use-after-free removing listeners in the event listener manager

cwe.name: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')

notes.text: The bufferdata function in WebGL is vulnerable to a buffer overflow with specific graphics drivers on Linux. This could result in malicious content freezing a tab or triggering a potentially exploitable crash. *Note: this issue only occurs on Linux. Other operating systems are unaffected.*. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Buffer overflow in WebGL bufferdata on Linux
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Buffer overflow in WebGL bufferdata on Linux

cwe.name: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere

notes.text: If a crafted hyperlink is dragged and dropped to the bookmark bar or sidebar and the resulting bookmark is subsequently dragged and dropped into the web content area, an arbitrary query of a user's browser history can be run and transmitted to the content page via drop event data. This allows for the theft of browser history by a malicious site. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7, Firefox < 67, and Firefox ESR < 60.7.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Theft of user history data through drag and drop of hyperlinks to and from bookmarks
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: In general, this flaw cannot be exploited through email in Thunderbird because scripting is disabled when reading mail, but it is potentially a risk in browser or browser-like contexts.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: Mozilla: Theft of user history data through drag and drop of hyperlinks to and from bookmarks
